mods.abstract: Pre-Columbian pottery with a polychromatic design, including black, white, red, and purple pigments. This motif includes horizontal bands of varying thickness and color, and a single band of repeated crossed lines or X shapes around the vessel shoulder. The rim is restrictive and everted, flaring out at the neck.
Fractures radiate outward from a break in the base that has been reassembled and glued. Rim is broken in two places.

titleInfo.title: Pre-Columbian vessels
Pre-Columbian cultural artifacts
George and Louis Patten collection of Salem Hyde papers and cultural artifacts
Special Collections
George and Louise Patten collection of Salem Hyde cultural artifacts

Metadata originally created in a locally modified version of Qualified Dublin Core using ContentDM (data dictionary available: https://dltn-technical-docs.readthedocs.io).
